intro: Benthamiella sorianoi, commonly known as the Sorianoi's benthamiella, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species for botanical research.
